title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 100.1 - State fiscal agent
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 100.1 - State fiscal agent

State Regulations

The State Comptroller, on behalf of the State, shall contract
with one or more banks or trust companies having an office located in the City
of New York, to act as fiscal agent of the State. The State fiscal agent shall
maintain an office for the registration, conversion, reconversion and transfer
of the bonds, notes and other obligations of the State, including the
preparation and substitution of new bonds, notes and other obligations, for the
payment of the principal thereof and interest thereon, and for related
services. This office shall be open for business during regular banking
hours. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
